snippet: By entering Burmese politics, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, a Nobel laureate, is increasingly being asked to propose solutions to her country’s woes rather than merely lamenting them.
abstract: Nobel laureate Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, leader of Myanmar's democracy movement, is transforming herself from dissident to stump politician as she campaigns for a seat in Parliament; by entering Burmese politics, she is increasingly being asked to stake her reputation as an activist by proposing solutions to her country’s woes.
lead_paragraph: By entering Burmese politics, Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, a Nobel laureate, is increasingly being asked to propose solutions to her country’s woes rather than merely lamenting them.

headline.seo: In Myanmar Election, a New Risk for Aung San Suu Kyi
headline.main: Election Puts Pressure on Myanmar Dissident
headline.print_headline: Election Puts Pressure on Myanmar Dissident
